title: Cloud Operations
content:
Use Cloud Operations to view and manage cloud account information that supports Cloud Cost Reporting. Cloud Operations displays the cloud accounts synchronized from supported cloud platforms and provides account-level context, such as hierarchy, ownership, and status.

View or manage accounts

Users with CMP Agent or Tenant Admin roles can view and manage cloud accounts.

To view or manage accounts:

  1. From the main menu, go to Run > Cloud Operations. This opens the Accounts tab.
  2. Click the record identifier in the ID column to display the selected record.
  3. Click the tab you want to view. The General tab appears by default.
Tab Description
General Displays details of the selected record. For more information, see the "General tab" section, below.
Workflow Displays the workflow phase for the selected record. For information about the workflow, see the "Workflow tab" section, below.
Finance The currency of cloud account and the associated cost center are displayed here. You can modify the cost center if required.
Threshold Events Displays the threshold events which are created when cloud costs breach the limit. 
Discussions Displays any relevant conversations about the current record. For more information about discussions, see Discussions.
History Displays changes to the selected record. For more information about history, see History.

General tab

Account details

This tab provides the following details related to the account:

  • Display label
  • Description
  • Account Id
  • Account Name
  • Provider Type
  • Account Type
  • Root Account
  • Account Scope
  • Account Status
  • Parent Account
  • Notification Groups
  • Primary Contact
  • Secondary Contact
  • Account Created Time
  • Account Modified Time
  • Last Sync Time

Notifications groups

By default, email notifications about cloud cost limit breach are sent to primary and secondary contacts. If you want to change this setting, select the required groups and contacts from Notification Groups, Primary Contact, and Secondary Contact dropdown lists. The notifications are now sent to all the members of the selected group(s) and contact(s).

Workflow tab

The Workflow tab displays the account management workflow. The workflow relies on business rules.

Metaphase: Creation

The cloud account is in creation phases, prior to being active.

Phase Transition Description
Draft Automatic

The starting point for a cloud account. The result of the phase is the successful creation of a cloud account.

Next phase: Active

Metaphase: Operation

The cloud account is effective and in creation stages.

Phase Transition Description
Active Automatic

The cloud account is in Active phase.

Next phase: Suspended
Suspended Automatic

The cloud account is suspended.

When the cloud account has reached end of life, the phase is in Suspended state.

Next phase: Archived

Metaphase: Done (End)

The cloud account's life cycle has ended.

Phase Transition Description
Archived None

The cloud account has been archived.

Next phase: None

OOTB cloud account reports

Here are some reports that are provided out of the box on the FinOps - Cloud Accounts dashboard.

  • Member Accounts Created in the Past Month (around 30 days until now): This report shows the member accounts created in the past month, around 30 days until now.
  • Member Accounts by Provider Type and Phase Id: This report shows the member accounts grouped by provider type and phase.
  • Member Accounts by Phase Id: This report groups the member accounts by phase.
  • Cloud Accounts Summary: This report shows the overall summary of cloud accounts.
  • Member Accounts by Provider Type and Root Account: This report shows the member accounts grouped by provider type and root account.
  • Root Accounts by Provider Type: This report shows the root accounts grouped by provider type.
